title.narrative: CHILD PROTECTION POLICIES & SYSTEMS

description.narrative: National Government has increased capacity to effectively plan, budget, coordinate and monitor the implementation of key family and child protection laws and policies., which contributes to Access To Justice, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, girls, boys and women nationally have increased access to and utilize preventive and responsive protection services that promote their safety, well-being and access to justice.

participating-org.narrative: DEPARTMENT FOR COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT AND RELIGION
DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE AND ATTORNEY GENERAL
NATIONAL OFFICE FOR CHILD AND FAMIL SERVICES

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National Government has increased capacity to effectively plan, budget, coordinate and monitor the implementation of key family andchild protection laws and policies.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued supporting Government in strengthening the child protection sector despite challenges posed by the continuing COVID-19 pandemic. Through technical assistance to key Government partners, namely OCFS and DJAG, critical institutional reforms were spearheaded and key results achieved. The draft CRC State Party Report was finialized and is ready for validation and submission, with K5 million budget awarded.;Enga Province established the first Provincial Child and Family Services Council;and succeeded in budgetary;allocations for 2021-2022 of K530,000, with six additional staff to implement the LPA 2015. Three provincial hospitals registered 412 births.;Four provincial coordination forums in justice for children were established.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/12/2021

baseline.value: Draft Rules of Court on LPA (child protection law) and Juvenile Justice exist

target.value: 2022:Rules of Court on LPA and Juvenile Justice enforced

actual.value: 2021:Four Provincial Juvenile Justice Committees established and functional
